author: Josh Houchins
title: Friday Night Football - October 16
text:
Friday Night Football - October 16 - WGEM.com: Quincy News, Weather, Sports, and Radio Member Center: Friday Night Football - October 16 Posted: Shamar Griffith had 309 yards rushing and 4 TD's as Hannibal knocked off defending Class 5 state champion Battle. 
**HS Football** 
Blue Devils: (5-3), become playoff eligbible 
Monmouth-Roseville: 8Reed Hyer: 80-yard kickoff return for TD (opening kickoff)Raiders: (6-2), earn spot in the playoffs for the 13th straight season 
Macomb: 
Titans: (6-2), earn playoff spot for the first time since 2007Chargers: (2-6) 
Brody Bivens: GW TD with :07 left (only carry of the game)Devon Buss: 28 carries, 135 yards, 3 TD'sPanthers: (4-4), keep playoff hopes intactWolves: (1-7) 
Brodie Dunker: 278 passing yards, 5 TD's (also 2 TD's rushing)Dawson Moore: 164 receiving yards, 3 TD'sCory Miller: 2 TD receptionsLance Barnett: 139 yards rushing, 2 TD'sMustangs: (6-2), earn playoff spot for the first time since 2010Cougars: (5-3) 
Ethan Downs: 87 yards rushing, 2 TD'sRylan Hynek: 68 yards rushing, 2 TD'sManning Plater: 78 yards receiving, TDRockets: (6-2), secures playoff spot for the second straight seasonSparclones: (2-6) 
Shamar Griffith: 309 yards rushing, 4 TD'sJerry McBride: 105 yards rushing, TDDevon Thomas: 8 tackles, sackPirates: (9-0), first undefeated regular season since 2000 
10) Palmyra: 33 Clayton Hudson: 155 yards rushing, 3 TD'sPhillip Bland: 109 yards rushing, TDNoah Mencer: 2 FG's
